org.springframework.datastore.mapping.core
Interface Datastore

All Known Subinterfaces:
ColumnDatastore, DocumentDatastore, GraphDatastore, RelationalDatastore
All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractDatastore, GemfireDatastore, MongoDatastore, RedisDatastore, RiakDatastore, SimpleMapDatastore
public interface Datastore

The Datastore interface is the basic commom denominator all NoSQL databases should support:

  • Storing data
  • Retrieving one or more elements at a time, identified by their keys
  • Deleting one or more elements

Method Summary
 Session connect()
          Connects to the datastore with the default connection details, normally provided via the datastore implementations constructor
 Session getCurrentSession()
          Obtains the current session (if any)
 MappingContext getMappingContext()
          Obtains the MappingContext object
 

Method Detail

connect

Session connect()
Connects to the datastore with the default connection details, normally provided via the datastore implementations constructor

Returns:
The session created using the default connection details.

getCurrentSession

Session getCurrentSession()
                          throws ConnectionNotFoundException
Obtains the current session (if any)

Returns:
The current thread bound session
Throws:
ConnectionNotFoundException - Thrown if the connect() method has not yet been called

getMappingContext

MappingContext getMappingContext()
Obtains the MappingContext object

Returns:
The MappingContext object
